intro: Lasianthera austrocaledonica, commonly known as the New Caledonian lily, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its striking, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the tropical rainforests of the region. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, often with a waxy texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
